articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
After the fall of Silvergate Bank, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), and Signature Bank (SNBY), First Republic Bank, a commercial bank and wealth management services provider, is the latest financial institution to receive a bailout. Close to a dozen lenders announced they will deposit $30 billion into the beleaguered bank’s coffers to shore up liquidity. U.S. banks have suffered from the financial contagion that followed the three bank failures last week. According to reports, depositors removed $8.8 billion from Charles Schwab Corporation’s prime money market funds.
 
Impact of Recent Bank Failures on U.S. Banking Industry Spurs Wave of Bailouts
 
Several banks received bailouts in the past week due to the collapse of three major U.S. banks. This event shook the banking industry, and banks of a…
articles.title: US Bank Outflows and Concerns Mount: 11 Banks Bail Out First Republic Bank From Collapse

articles.author: Omkar Godbole
articles.description: Integration with TradingView promises global exposure to Volmex's implied volatility indices for bitcoin and ether.
articles.title: Crypto Derivatives Protocol Volmex Finance's Bitcoin and Ether Volatility Charts Now Live on TradingView

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
One of the biggest influencers in the crypto space, Ben Armstrong, better known as “BitBoy,” has delivered on his threat and revealed the alleged identity of the secret Shiba Inu founder. In his latest 20-minute video, Armstrong refers to Neyma Jahan as the father of SHIB – but the latter denies the revelations.
 
Here Is The Alleged Evidence Leading To The Shiba Inu Founder
 
The identity of Shiba Inu founder “Ryoshi” was previously a big secret with a lot of speculation surrounding it. As Bitcoinist reported, Coinbase’s Conor Grogan found out a few weeks ago that an Open Sea account of former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) was linked to Ryoshi’s. As a result, speculation surfaced that SBF himself is the founder of Shiba Inu.
 
However, according to BitBoy, this was merely the key to rev…
articles.title: Identity Of Shiba Inu Founder Revealed By BitBoy, Here’s Who He Is

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Bitcoin moved to a fresh nine-month high on Friday, as prices moved above the $27,000 level. The surge comes following the U.S. Federal Reserve’s decision to backstop embattled banks to a record tune of $152.9 billion. Ethereum was also in the green in today’s session. 
 
Bitcoin
 
Bitcoin (BTC) rose back above $27,000 in today’s session, as markets reacted to the Federal Reserve’s decision to pump liquidity into the U.S. economy.
 
Following a low of $24,624.74 on Thursday, BTC/USD raced to an intraday peak of $27,002.39 earlier in the day.
 
As a result of the move, bitcoin climbed to its strongest point since June 2022, when price was above $28,500.
 
 
Bitcoin chart by TradingView
 

 
 

 
Since this latest rally, the 10-day (red) moving average is now on the verge of an upwards cross…
articles.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: BTC Hits $27,000, Securing Fresh 9-Month High

articles.author: Jamie Crawley
articles.description: The company said on Friday it had filed for court-supervised reorganization in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York to preserve value.
articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank's Parent Company Files for Bankruptcy

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
21Shares is set to delist its Terra exchange-traded product (ETP) and pull the plug on five other cryptocurrency ETPs, citing a lack of investor interest. 
 
The move comes as the firm looks to streamline its offerings and focus on more promising opportunities in the ever-evolving digital asset space. 
 
Bloomberg reports that the affected ETPs will begin closing next month, despite only being open for less than a year.
 
 
21Shares ETPs Suffer Blow As Investors Dwindle
 
The cumulative assets under control of the six ETP closures are less than $700,000.
 
The 21Shares USD Yield ETP (USDY), 21Shares Crypto Layer 1 ETP (LAY1), 21Shares S&P Risk Controlled Bitcoin Index ETP (SPBTC), 21Shares DeFi 10 Infrastructure ETP (DEFII), and 21Shares S&P Risk Controlled Ethereum Index ETP (SPETH) are a…
articles.title: 21Shares Delists Terra ETP, Terminates 5 Other Crypto ETPs Amid Low Investor Demand

articles.author: Terence Zimwara
articles.description:
The Africa-focused venture capital (VC) firm, Echovc, has launched a fund that seeks to support blockchain startups on the continent. While global blockchain funding has been on a decline over the past year, Echovc founder Eghosa Omoigui claimed that investing now enables the VC to get in “at lower entry valuations on average than in prior years.”
 
Startups Offering Blockchain-Based Solutions Qualify for Funding
 
The pan-African venture capital firm, Echovc, recently said it had launched an $8 million fund which is dedicated to Africa’s blockchain startups. According to the company’s blog post, the fund known as the Echovc Chain will be accessible to startups that are attempting to solve the continent’s challenges using the blockchain.
 
As noted in a report by Techcabal, Echovc’s new fu…
articles.title: Africa-Focused Venture Capital Firm Echovc Launches Blockchain Fund

articles.author: Arnab Shome
articles.description:
Deribit, a major crypto options trading platform, will launch futures contracts to facilitate Bitcoin volatility trading, the exchange announced. It will be the first such crypto derivatives instrument in the market and will be priced, margined, and settled in USDC.

Deribit to Offer BTC Volatility Contracts

The BTC DVOL futures will be based on the Deribit Bitcoin Volatility Index (DVOL), a parameter that measures the volatility of the cryptocurrency across markets. It is calculated by implied
articles.title: Deribit to Launch Futures Contracts for Bitcoin Volatility Trading

articles.author: Jack Schickler
articles.description: The company wants to sell off its business after filing for bankruptcy on Jan. 19.
articles.title: Genesis Requests Timetable for Sale, Creditor Claims

articles.author: Will Canny
articles.description: Investors are shifting into bitcoin from stablecoins as well as more volatile cryptocurrencies, the report said.
articles.title: Bitcoin Is Benefiting From Crypto’s Flight to Quality: Matrixport

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Playboy, founded by the late Hugh Hefner, announced a staggering impairment loss of $5 million on its Ethereum holdings from last year. The company attributed the loss to the prolonged crypto winter that had a significant impact on the broader market, causing a decline in cryptocurrency prices.
 
During the pinnacle of the crypto market in October 2021, the company unveiled its “Rabbitar” NFT project. According to TradingView data, Ether, the native coin of Ethereum, has lost over 60% of its value since then.
 
Playboy Gets Whipped As Ethereum Value Plummets
 
According to an annual report on Thursday, the media company accepted Ethereum as payment for its Rabbitars NFTs, which were released in 2021 and are held on its balance sheet as digital assets.
 
“The market price of one Ethereum in…
articles.title: Playboy Accepts Ethereum As NFT Payments And Ends Up Losing $5 Million

articles.author: Shaurya Malwa
articles.description: Claims of “no airdrop” on a popular prediction market fell steeply in a single day after Arbitrum confirmed its airdrop on Thursday.
articles.title: Crypto Speculators Betting on ‘No Airdrop’ for Arbitrum Lose 95% of Capital

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
An international operation has taken down Chipmixer, a cryptocurrency mixing service that allegedly laundered more than $3 billion worth of cryptocurrency, according to the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ). The operation involved national authorities in the U.S., Germany, Belgium, Poland, and Switzerland — with Europol’s support.
 
International Operation Takes Down Chipmixer
 
The U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) announced Wednesday “a coordinated international takedown of Chipmixer,” which it described as “a darknet cryptocurrency ‘mixing’ service responsible for laundering more than $3 billion worth of cryptocurrency.” Europol, which provided support for the operation to take down the mixing service, independently announced:
 

National authorities took down the infrastructure of the pl…
articles.title: International Operation Takes Down Crypto Mixer Chipmixer — Creator Could Face 40 Years in Prison

articles.author: Semilore Faleti
articles.description:
Hong Kong is rapidly becoming an attraction site for the crypto industry as the city maintains strong efforts in converting its territory into a global crypto hub. In the latest news, a cryptocurrency data firm, Kaiko, becomes the latest Web3 company to be attracted by Hong Kong’s crypto-friendly regulations.
 
Kaiko To Relocate Its Asian Headquarters To Hong Kong
 
According to a report by Bloomberg on March 17, Kaiko has announced its plans to move its Asian headquarters from Singapore to Hong Kong, citing the city’s pro-crypto policies and impressive recovery from covid-related restrictions as reasons, among others.
 
Providing more insight into the company’s decision, Kaiko’s CEO, Ambre Soubrian, said: “With all of the recent changes and initiatives from the Hong Kong regulatory bodies…
articles.title: Hong Kong Set To Welcome Prominent Crypto Data Firm

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
If Ripple wins against the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in its legal battle, a relisting of the XRP token on the largest American crypto exchange Coinbase will be one of the biggest stories within the XRP community. In a new interview, Paul Grewal, Chief Legal Officer (CLO) at Coinbase has now spoken in detail about the issue and explained what the process of a XRP relisting will look like.
 
Coinbase had suspended trading of XRP in January 2021, shortly after the SEC filed its case, and has since kept the token suspended despite vocal demands from the XRP community. In yesterday’s interview with Thinking Crypto host Tony Edward, Grewal expressed his optimism for a Ripple win, but also stressed that a relisting does not depend solely on the question of a victory at trial cou…
articles.title: Coinbase To Relist XRP Immediately After Ripple Win? Here’s When

articles.description: Bitcoin's swift move above a resistance dating back to August 2022 has strengthened the case for a continued rally.
articles.title: Bitcoin Breakout Has Put $28K in Cross Hairs
